channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Missouri Woman Charged in Scheme to Sell Graceland
item.description: A woman named Lisa Jeanine Findley was arrested and accused of a brazen effort to foreclose on Elvis Presley’s home in Memphis.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Iran Is Expected to Delay Retaliation Over Killing of Hamas Leader, Officials Say
item.description: U.S., Iranian and Israeli officials say that Tehran appears to be allowing mediators time to pursue cease-fire talks between Israel and Hamas that are seen as a chance to avert a wider regional war, but the situation is fluid.

item.title: Kamala Harris’ presidential prospects lift consumer sentiment
item.description: Americans' spirits are an important gauge for whether they're in the mood to shop; spending accounts for about 70% of U.S. economic activity.

item.title: Typhoon Ampil Lashes Eastern Japan, Forcing Evacuations
item.description: The authorities have warned that the storm, which has already flooded some streets in the Tokyo area, could bring violent winds and cause landslides.

item.title: Typhoon Ampil Lashes Eastern Japan, Forcing Evacuations
item.description: The authorities have warned that the storm, which has already flooded some streets in the Tokyo area, could bring violent winds and cause landslides.

item.title: The rich can’t sell their art, so they’re using it as collateral for cash loans
item.description: “There are margin calls, death, divorce and bankruptcy, so we have endless interest for lending,” says one advisor.

item.title: The Onion Adds a Monthly Print Edition
item.description: The satirical site is hoping a newspaper with fake stories and fake ads will lead to real money.

item.title: Typhoon Ampil Brings Heavy Rains and Floods to Eastern Japan
item.description: The storm forced evacuations and caused widespread travel disruptions.

item.title: Meta pulled its disinformation tracker from Facebook months before America heads to the polls, and the EU isn’t happy
item.description: CrowdTangle was used by researchers to identify and track viral falsehoods, but it was closed without a replacement in place on Wednesday.

item.title: Harris to Lay Out Economic Message Focused on High Cost of Living
item.description: The vice president’s plans represent more of a reboot of President Biden’s economic policies than a radically fresh start.

item.title: The United States, Egypt and Qatar are racing to bridge gaps between Israel and Hamas.
‘Black Swan’ hedge funder warns a recession is coming this year—and the biggest market bubble in history will soon pop
item.description: “It’s not different this time,” Mark Spitznagel, cofounder and CIO of the private hedge fund Universa Investments, told Fortune.

item.title: Biden Will Designate Illinois Race Riot Site as a National Monument
item.description: The 1908 riot started by a white lynch mob in Springfield destroyed a Black neighborhood and led to the creation of the N.A.A.C.P.

item.title: Ukraine’s Push Into Russia Met Early Success. Where Does It Go From Here?
item.description: Ukraine’s forces could try advancing farther on Russian soil, or return to the front line, where Moscow is making gains. There are arguments for various options.

item.title: Google’s ex-CEO isn’t licensed to give financial advice, but he thinks you should buy Nvidia
item.description: With tech firms investing "mind-boggling" amounts of money to win the AI race, their chip supplier of choice is the best positioned to win from the gold rush.
